standard_metadata.standard_description: Add, subtract, multiply, and divide decimals to hundredths, using concrete models or drawings and strategies based on place value, properties of operations, and/or the relationship between addition and subtraction; relate the strategy to a written method and explain the reasoning used.

hints.content: There are many ways to solve this problem. Let's see two ways we can solve it.
###Place Value  We can think in terms of tenths:  $\begin{align} &\phantom{=}0.7 + 0.5\\\\ &=7\text{ tenths} + 5\text{ tenths}\\\\ &=12\text{ tenths}\\\\ &=1.2 \end{align}$

###Place Value Grids  We can use tenths grids:  $\blueE{0.7} =$  [[☃ image 1]]  $\maroonD{0.5}=$  [[☃ image 2]]  $\blueE{0.7} + \maroonD{0.5}=$  [[☃ image 3]]  [[☃ image 4]]  $\blueE{0.7} + \maroonD{0.5} = 1.2$

images.alt: A square divided into 10 columns to show tenths. 7 of the columns are shaded to represent 7 tenths.
A square divided into 10 columns to show tenths. 5 of the columns are shaded to represent 5 tenths.
Two equal size squares. Each square is divided into 10 columns to show tenths. In the first square, 7 columns are shaded in blue and 3 columns are shaded in pink.
In the second square, 2 columns are shaded in pink.

###Place Value  We can think in terms of tenths:  $\begin{align} &\phantom{=}0.4 + 0.6\\\\ &=4\text{ tenths} + 6\text{ tenths}\\\\ &=10\text{ tenths}\\\\ &=1.0 \end{align}$
###Place Value Grids  We can use tenths grids:  $\blueE{0.4}=$  [[☃ image 1]]  $\maroonD{0.6} =$  [[☃ image 2]]  $\blueE{0.4} + \maroonD{0.6} =$  [[☃ image 3]]  $\blueE{0.4} + \maroonD{0.6} = 1$

images.alt: A square divided into 10 columns to show tenths. 4 of the columns are shaded to represent 4 tenths.
A square divided into 10 columns to show tenths. 6 of the columns are shaded to represent 6 tenths.
